data.title: TANK MAGAZINE
data.meta_description: A thing of beauty and permanence in an age of transience. Since 1998.
data.text:
TANK MAGAZINE | The Maxico! Issue, Spring 2015 | Issue 62

fronting

JULIE DE LIBRAN TAKES ON SONIA RYKIEL by Dan Thawley

DESIGNER PROFILES: CALVIN KLEIN, Kevin Carrigan transcending denim

CHEREVICHKIOTVICHKI's Dadaist footwear

THE QUIET AMERICAN: Charles Harbison makes contradictory clothes

PRINGLE OF SCOTLAND addresses the future of fashion

CARLA FERNANDEZ finds haute couture in the Mexican mountains

features

FEATURES: HYBRID TIMES, Álvaro Enrigue on Mexico City as mille-feuille

A FLOATING CORK: Juan Carlos Cano and the architecture of the floating city

A STORM IN A FURRY TEACUP: Lidija Haas explores the complex legacy of Surrealism in Mexican art

Ignacio M. Sánchez Prado traces the FAULT LINES of class in Mexico City cinema

MEXICAN MODERNISTS: Ana Elena Mallet resurrects three forgotten mid-century designers

DESIGN CHAOS: the impact of informality by Mario Ballesteros

ORIGINAL SIN: Sergio González Rodríguez on the state of Mexican politics

IT WAS THE STATE: Tony Wood hears echoes of Mexico’s 1970s Dirty War in the aftermath of the disappeared students of Ayotzinapa

CURATED PAGES: a poetic turn in Mexico City, by Gabriela Jáuregui

radio

fashion

FASHION: WALK THE LINE by Hart+Lëshkina and Catherine Newell-Hanson

talk

TALK: AGUSTIN HERNANDEZ creates unique architecture

GUILLERMO FADANELLI is Mexico City’s ultimate chronicler

DIEGO RABASA publishes Sexto Piso

TATIANA BILBAO has a social intent

ANABEL HERNANDEZ is a heroine of journalism

ENRIQUE OLVERA redefines fine dining

FERNANDO ROMERO builds big

PATRICK CHARPENEL breaks out of Polanco

GUADALUPE NETTEL writes from difference

flash-fiction

FLASH FICTION: THE ADVENTURES OF THE INCREDIBLE SHRINKING WOMAN by Cristina Rivera Garza
